page.title: 03DWELLINGS - GENERAL
page.content: Bishampton is a linear village set in gently rolling hills. Originally a spring line settlement, it has undergone considerable development recently. Of the 202 houses in the village, the vast majority (151) have been built in the last 50 years. twenty-two half-timbered "black and white" cottages still remain from the Tudor period and there are twelve "farmworkers" cottages built between the 18th century and the turn of this century. There are 102 detached houses and 100 semi-detached, 147 dwellings have a garage, which is not surprising as about 200 cars are owned in the village, most families having at least one car and many two.Most children own a bicycle and several people have motor-bikes.
